intro: Myosotis × pseudohispida, commonly known as the hybrid forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Myosotis × pseudohispida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in floral arrangements.
